channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large fridge and other small items, 30th June
item.description:
Been outside number 28 for nearly two weeks. I think assumption is that it will be taken by council. It does belong to the house so hopefully it will be disposed of and occupants billed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alconbury Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Estate cleaner needed at 1-35 Hunsdon House, 30th June
item.description:
Flat is believed to have not been cleaned for years. When the estate cleaner comes, he only cleans the ground floor. Residents on elevated floors would also like for their landings to be swept, cleared of rubbish etc. Please can the estate cleaner attend.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Footpath, 30th June
item.description:
Resident called to report that the pathway (gated and locked) at the back of number 16 Betsham road needs clearing, the resident is a wheelchair user and this is her only way of getting in and out of the property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Betsham Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish on the Pavement which is building up, 30th June
item.description:
Rubbish hasn't been collected and passer bys have piled more on top

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Browning Street, Walworth, London

item.title: Lit roundabout sign and post knocked out of ground, 30th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, London

Please remove.

Several big items left on the pavement. Obstructing the street and people starting to leave bin there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Listria Park, Hackney, London

item.title: Abondoned BIN, 30th June
item.description:
This BIN has been abandoned for weeks now doesnt belong to any business or resdience. People have been filling it with rubbish and a lorry has just knocked it over into the road. Buses been having issues getting round it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no. 36, 30th June
item.description:
The street lamp outside no. 36 was rusted at the bottom. Instead of removing it, the contractor cut it and installed a new street lamp next to it. The damaged street lamp column still remains next to the new street lamp, months later. Grateful if someone would come to finish the job and remove the damaged column.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glenhurst Avenue, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsed tree, 30th June
item.description:
Tree collapsed across pathway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 156, Clapham Park Road, Clapham, London

item.title: Multiple bags of building materials left outside 52 Holmwood, 30th June

Three bags have been there for several days with further bags delivered today (30th June)

item.title: Flytipping opposite 1 Oakham Drive, 30th June
item.description:
Rubbish was dumped more than 10 days ago and looks very unsightly.

item.title: Reflective marking, 30th June
item.description:
Good afternoon, I notice that all the cycle hangers being used in Hackney have no reflective markings on them to show road users where they are in the dark so not to crash into them, should they not be illuminated like rubbish skips have to.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dumont Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Soil in bags, wood, bins to the side of Indian Restaurant, 30th June
item.description:
Repeated dumping of unwanted material, fly-tipping & bins left on St Margaret’s Avenue. All bins should be stored at the back of properties on the High Street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1363 - 1365, High Road, Whetstone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses fly tipping, 30th June
item.description:
Please help! They dumped these mattresses on the pavement outside 45 Londesborough Road - and a few days back someone put them inside our front garden!! They probably mistakenly thought we dumped them on the pavement.. please remove them thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Londesborough Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncollected rubbish bags and big boxes on the pavement near tfnc store, 30th June
item.description:
Uncollected rubbish

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32-36, Great Portland Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside nu 47 star street, 30th June
item.description:
This is an almost everyday occurrence. Other tenants leave their rubbish out for collection on Monday and Thursdays. Not number 47. Westminster refuse don’t collect this rubbish as it isn’t all black bin household rubbish. It is owned by a hotelier who lets out the flats but there is ALWAYS rubbish outside on every day of the week. Can someone speak to the owner please so he can tell his occupants about the rubbish
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Star Street, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, 30th June
item.description:
Left outside tube

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rampayne Street, Millbank, London
